description: The content to display as the label.
The name of the time input element, used when submitting an HTML form.
The current value (controlled).
The default value (uncontrolled).
The variant of the time input.

type: default | primary | secondary | success | warning | danger
description: The color of the time input.
The size of the time input.
The radius of the time input.
Whether to display the time in 12 or 24 hour format. By default, this is determined by the user's locale.
Determines the smallest unit that is displayed in the time picker.
Whether to hide the time zone abbreviation.
The position of the label.
Whether to always show leading zeros in the hour field. By default, this is determined by the user's locale.
A placeholder time that influences the format of the placeholder shown when no value is selected.
The minimum allowed time that a user may select.
The maximum allowed time that a user may select.
Whether the time input is disabled.
Whether the time input can be selected but not changed by the user.
Whether user time input is required on the time input before form submission.
Whether the time input is invalid.
Whether the element should receive focus on render.
A description for the field. Provides a hint such as specific requirements for what to choose.
An error message for the field.
Validate input values when committing (e.g. on blur), returning error messages for invalid values.
Whether to use native HTML form validation or ARIA validation. When wrapped in a Form component, the default is `aria`. Otherwise, the default is `native`.
Whether to disable the animation of the time input.
Allows to set custom class names for the time input slots.
